text:
KLar, brunorange, ljust skum.
Doft: lakrits, honung, torkade fikon, lite, syrlig.
Smak: lakrits, honung, malt, lite charkrökig, lätt, trevlig.
Bottle at Akkurat. Amber with a small head. On the sweet side with smoke, malt, some wood and caramel. Also some juniper. The body was medium and the bitterness quite light.
Fat bishops. Rödbrun grumlig vätska. Doft av charkuterier, rök och ljunghonung. Liknande i smak. Söt med jordiga inslag av torv och enris.

Provsmak på Närke Kulturbryggeri, fat. Mörk bärnstensfärgad, lätt disig. Ganska matt och len med stor rökiga toner av torv, aska, enrisavkok med en ton av honung, pors och kryddiga inslag. Lite örtig med en del sötma och nästan lite chark i avslutningen. Avslutar åt det torrare hållet. Stor rökighet.
Bottle. Pours deep amber verging on brown with no head. Aroma is smoke with a hint of soft red berry. Taste is huge smoke, malty sweet, slight berry tart, slight bitterness.

500ml bottle @ Bishops Arms, Örebro. Great pour, this is a looker! Deep amber, creamy tobacco stained white head, rich sticky lacing all around the glass. Smoky aroma, leather, oily tobacco, peat, herbs, deep old moisture forest moss, juniper, wet wood, bog myrtle, earthy and mushrooms. Velvety mouthfeel, full bodied, soft carbonation. Taste follows the aroma, this is one of a kind, perfect balance between all the complex flavors. Sweet malty, floral bitter, herbal and the smoke is perfectly lifting the taste and instead of dominating it. Pleasant floral bitter finish. Thanks for this!
Draught at Haket. Copper color. Smokey and woody malty taste, interesting beer, very balanced.

Draught at Haket Batch#2 Beer Festival Cons 2017-04-15 Göteborg
AR: sweet birch smokey
AP: cloudy amber, stouty cream caramel lid
F: caramel, juniper, dry, wee honey, sweet smokey

500ml bottle (Metenis 2017, Riga)
Deep red rye beer look. Rich bacony smoked sausage aroma. Very sausagey taste, lovely balanced smoke. Drying finish, with an almost peppery bite. Some reddish berries in the finish. Anna got them in the aroma too. Gets better with every sip, score creeped up a couple of times.

At Haket Beer Festival Batch #2, April 15, 2017.Draught.Clear copper color, off-white head. Smoked, malty scent. Smoked, wood, malty taste. Smoked aftertaste. Warming alcohol. Medium to fizzy mouthfeel, medium bitterness.
bottle. copper with small white head. aroma of smoked malt. medium sweet, smoky with herbal notes and lightly bitter finish

3/III/17 - on tap @ ACBF (Vichte) - BB: n/a (2017-338) Thanks to all ratebeerians for sharing todays beers!
Clear amber red beer, small creamy off-white head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very spicy, rosemary, apothecary, peated, smoky, weird. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: WTF? This is very weird, peated, overly spiced, rosemary, malty, bitter. Aftertaste: grassy, spicy bitterness, peated, dried fruits, bitter, meh.
Sample at ACBF 2017. Clear golden amber color. Brisk peat and smoke aroma. taste is smouldering straw. Delicious.

dark notes from Metenis! I am not an expert to feel difference between this and smoked, because smoke aroma was quite intense in this one, but never over the line. Felt balanced with malty background and some herbal aspect. Liked
Notes from #Metenis event. Amber with small white head. Medium strong smoked aroma. Medium bitterness, slight sweetness and medium uami with roasted notes.

ACBF 2017. Thank you for sharing kraddel, tderoeck, Travlr & friends. Sampled bottled. amber orange, little head. Nose is extremely peated oil, bergamot oil, medicinal oil. Taste is just peated oil, rosemary, peated hop oil, medicinal, chemical, almost vegetable, extremely weird. Body is hugely oily. Interesting for peat heads I assume, I found it to be just extremely weird.
Sampled @ ACBF Vichte 2017. Klare orange goldene Farbe, mittelgroße beige Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr holzig, rauchig, Kräuter. Geschmack nach rauchigen Gewürzen, Kräuter, holzig.
Intensiv rauchiger Geruch. Süß rauchiger Start, trocken herb. Leichte Noten von Tannennadeln, süffig, gut. 10/9/10/10//9

Small yellowish rim over clear red-copper beer. Intense spicy nose, shoepolish, juniperberry (probably the bog myrtle), and Rauchmalz. Nutty, spicy, cardamom, bit of sovent, spruce, caramel. Very complex, and the smoked malt helping again, without overpowering. Light to medium bodied, very long lasting flavours. Special. Here classified as "smoked" (which it is, no doubt), but IMHO, it is the spice, the Myrica Gale, as mentioned on the label, which explains the real complexity.

Sampled from tap at ACBF 2017. Clear, golden amber with a beige head. Sweetish, very smoky aroma of caramel, lots of smoked ham and juniper. Slightly sweetish, a bit dry, very smoky and spicy taste of caramel, smoked ham, juniper and hints of peat, followed by a medium long, moderately bitter, very smoky and spicy finish. Medium body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very nice!
From tap. Pours clear and golden orange to amber with a small white head. Aroma is solid smoked and meaty. Dense peated and smoked. Deep smoked and meaty. Dry and lingering smoked finish.
